item.title: The Intercept、Alternet、Raw Storyが、OpenAIに対する訴訟でデジタル・ミレニアム著作権法をどのように利用しているか。
item.description:
Andrew Deck / Nieman Lab:
How The Intercept, Alternet, and Raw Story are using the Digital Millennium Copyright Act in suits against OpenAI, possibly serving as a model for other sites  —  Raw Story, AlterNet, and The Intercept are among the first smaller publications to go up against the AI goliath for copyright violations.

item.title: YouTube TVがiOSとiPadOSでMultiviewサポートを開始、4つのTVチャンネルを同時に視聴可能に、Androidサポートは "今後数ヶ月で "展開される（Ben Schoon/9to5Google）
item.description:
Ben Schoon / 9to5Google:
YouTube TV rolls out Multiview support on iOS and iPadOS, letting users watch four TV channels at once; Android support will roll out “in the coming months”  —  Google has confirmed that YouTube TV is now rolling out support for Multiview on the iPhone and iPad, but the feature won't arrive on Android for a while.

item.title: フランスのTF1は、ストリーミング・プラットフォームを2024年6月にベルギーとルクセンブルグに、そして今後18ヶ月以内にフランス語圏のアフリカ諸国に拡大する計画だ（Benoit Berthelot/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Benoit Berthelot / Bloomberg:
France's TF1 plans to expand its streaming platform to Belgium and Luxembourg in June 2024, and to French-speaking African countries in the next 18 months  —  - TF1+ will expand to more French-speaking markets this year  — CEO Belmer aims to grow base of advertisers for platform

item.title: TikTok売却法案は、敵対する外国勢力が主要なコミュニケーション・プラットフォームを支配することを禁じるという、米国の長く重要な伝統に合致する（Zephyr Teachout/The Atlantic）
item.description:
Zephyr Teachout / The Atlantic:
The TikTok divestment bill fits into a long and important US tradition of forbidding a hostile foreign power from controlling a major communication platform  —  America has a long history of shielding infrastructure and communication platforms from foreign control.

item.title: デロイト調査：米消費者、4つの動画ストリーミングサービスに月平均61ドルを支払い、前年比27％増、36％が利用可能なコンテンツは価格に見合わないと回答（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Deloitte study: US consumers pay an average of $61 per month for four video streaming services, up 27% YoY; 36% say available content is not worth the price  —  Streaming video services continue to face challenges like high costs, high churn rates and competition from other media …

item.title: X、ネオナチ漫画家ストーントスの本名疑惑を投稿した一部のジャーナリストと研究者のアカウントを停止、ストーントスがマスク氏に訴えたため（David Gilbert/Wired）
item.description:
David Gilbert / Wired:
X suspends the accounts of some journalists and researchers who posted the alleged real name of neo-Nazi cartoonist Stonetoss, after Stonetoss appealed to Musk  —  Researchers and journalists have been blocked on X from sharing the alleged identity of the neo-Nazi cartoonist Stonetoss.

item.title: ニューヨークのチャンネル5で12年間『10時のニュース』のキャスターを務めた放送ジャーナリスト、ビル・ヨルゲンセン氏が3月13日、96歳で死去した（Richard Sandomir/New York Times）。
item.description:
Richard Sandomir / New York Times:
Bill Jorgensen, a broadcast journalist who anchored The 10 O'Clock News on New York's Channel 5 for 12 years, died on March 13 at 96  —  Getting his start in the Midwest, he was best known for leading the New York broadcast “The 10 O'Clock News.”  —  Bill Jorgensen, a serious-minded broadcast journalist …

item.title: ニューハウス・ファミリーのアドバンスは、レディットが木曜日にニューヨーク証券取引所に上場すると、14億ドルの大金を手にすることになる。アドバンスのCondé Nastは、2006年にレディットを1000万ドルで買収している（ニューヨーク・タイムズ）。
item.description:
New York Times:
The Newhouse family's Advance is set to reap a $1.4B windfall when Reddit lists on the NYSE on Thursday; Advance's Condé Nast bought Reddit for $10M in 2006  —  The Newhouse family, which controls the Advance media empire, made a 2006 investment of $10 million in the social site, which plans to go public on Thursday.

item.title: Redditは市場デビューに先立ち、IPO価格を予想レンジの上限である1株あたり34ドルに設定し、5億1900万ドルを調達、同社の価値を約65億ドルとした（CNBC）
item.description:
CNBC:
Reddit priced its IPO at $34 per share, the top of its expected range, raising $519M and valuing the company at about $6.5B, ahead of its market debut  —  - Reddit priced its IPO on Wednesday at $34 a share, valuing the social media company at about $6.5 billion.

item.title: PENアメリカはパレスチナ人作家のための緊急資金を寄付し、イスラエル・ガザ戦争へのPENの対応について話し合うため、指導者との面談に批評家を招待する（Richard Luscombe/The Guardian）
item.description:
Richard Luscombe / The Guardian:
PEN America donates emergency funds for Palestinian writers and invites critics to meet with its leadership to discuss PEN's response to the Israel-Gaza war  —  The writers group is also making a ‘substantial financial contribution’ to fund for distribution to Palestinian writers

item.title: LexisNexis傘下のLaw360の編集部員が3月20日、レイオフに抗議して24時間の労働ストップを行った。
item.description:
Chris Roush / Talking Biz News:
Editorial workers at LexisNexis-owned Law360 walked off the job March 20 in a 24-hour work stoppage to protest layoffs; workers said Law360 cut 10% of the staff  —  Unionized editorial workers, represented by The NewsGuild of New York at LexisNexis-owned Law360, have walked off the job in a 24-hour work stoppage to protest layoffs.
